intro: Cyphostemma vollesenii, commonly known as the African moon vine, is a climbing plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae and is characterized by its slender, twining stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by follicles that contain elongated seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or coastal areas. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
